alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 7:28PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yellowstone, northern Rosebud and northwestern Treasure Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 726 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Melstone, or 25 miles northwest of Hysham, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain will cause ponding of water on roadways and in low-lying areas. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yellowstone, northern Rosebud and northwestern Treasure Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
